{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3544896,"name":"Harrison","username":"hjmcphail76","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/hjmcphail76/{size}/234713_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-02T16:11:48.394Z","cooked":"

Hello all.

We run photonvision with two cameras on an orange pi 5. Yesterday, we got to run our robot on a full field, and it works perfectly when looking at the reef when my autopilot code runs, same goes for Human Player stations. However, sometimes the cameras will see an AprilTag from far away (HP, the processor, barge, etc) and will make our robot pose jump around A LOT within about a meter or two of the actual pose. This messes up both our auto and the autopilot alignment and gives suboptimal results that just won’t work. I tried both lowest ambiguity and multitag. We use arducam 70 FOV global shutter cameras.

How can I “filter” out the targets that have high ambiguity or in this case are to far away?

I was under the impression that MultiTag has low ambiguity, but doesn’t seem to be that way from the experience

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":7,"updated_at":"2025-03-02T16:13:34.284Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":135,"reads":149,"readers_count":148,"score":719.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":493859,"topic_slug":"photonvision-multitag-filters","display_username":"Harrison","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":57833,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/photonvision-multitag-filters/493859/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3544901,"name":"Owen Busler","username":"Owen_Busler","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/owen_busler/{size}/7684_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-02T16:21:13.718Z","cooked":"

you can get the pose ambiguity from an April tag pipeline result in the photon vision library. we added a filter in code to ignore results with ambiguities that were too high. we also check the distance to the best tag in the result and if that distance is greater than three or so meters we throw the result out as well.

Do you have a code example? I can’t find a way to do this by removing a target instead of the whole result

we throw out the entire result.

  3. public void updatePhotonVision() {
    4. 
          
  4. 
          
  5.     integrateCamera(useProcessorCam, processorCam, processorPoseEstimator, photonField2d_processor, visionMaxATDist);
    6.

    7.

    8.

    9. 
          
  9. }
    10.

  11. public void integrateCamera(boolean useCamera, PhotonCamera camera, PhotonPoseEstimator estimator, Field2d photonField, double maxDistance) {
    12. 
          
  12.     List<PhotonPipelineResult> cameraPipeline = camera.getAllUnreadResults();
    13. 
          
  13.     
    14. 
          
  14.     if (cameraPipeline.size() > 0) {
    15. 
          
  15.         Optional<EstimatedRobotPose> photonPose = estimator.update(cameraPipeline.get(0));
    16. 
          
  16.         if (photonPose.isPresent()) {
    17. 
          
  17.             photonField.setRobotPose(photonPose.get().estimatedPose.toPose2d());
    18. 
          
  18.             double tag0Dist = cameraPipeline.get(0).getBestTarget().bestCameraToTarget.getTranslation().getNorm();
    19. 
          
  19.             double poseAmbaguitiy = cameraPipeline.get(0).getBestTarget().getPoseAmbiguity();
    20. 
          
  20.             if (useCamera && tag0Dist < maxDistance && poseAmbaguitiy < 0.05) {
    21. 
          
  21.                 thisRobot.drivebase.swerveDrive.addVisionMeasurement(photonPose.get().estimatedPose.toPose2d(),
    22.

So correct me if I am wrong, but are you essintially throwing out the whole result if the furthest apriltag is over the threshold? Also, I see the strategy is set to multitag, what is the backup strategy set to for if you only see one?

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":7,"updated_at":"2025-03-02T18:40:52.708Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":88,"readers_count":87,"score":37.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":493859,"topic_slug":"photonvision-multitag-filters","display_username":"Harrison","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":23320,"username":"Owen_Busler","name":"Owen Busler","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/owen_busler/{size}/7684_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":57833,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/photonvision-multitag-filters/493859/5","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3544974,"name":"Owen Busler","username":"Owen_Busler","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/owen_busler/{size}/7684_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-02T18:53:32.536Z","cooked":"

that is correct, we throw out the entire result if the “best tag” is too far away. In practice, this allows us to nicely transition between the reef tags and the coral station/processor tags.

I believe in the UI we have “always do single tag localization” also checked. So this does single tagbPNP?

PhotonVision Documentation

MultiTag Localization

PhotonVision can combine AprilTag detections from multiple simultaneously observed AprilTags from a particular camera with information about where tags are expected to be located on the field to pr...

If multiple tags are seen, ambiguity is set to -1 (I think that’s the right value) in the estimated robot pose from PhotonVision. In the multi-tag case, you can use the reprojection error to filter out pose estimates: result.multitagResult.get().estimatedPose.bestReprojErr
